Senior Data Analyst Every year, $60 billion of public benefits such as SNAP (food assistance) and Medicaid go untapped. At the same time, millions of people struggle to pay for food, housing, and healthcare. Many are eligible for assistance but don't know it or are deterred by the complicated enrollment process.  Benefits Data Trust (BDT)  uses data, digital and non-digital products, targeted outreach, and policy and practice change to connect people to benefits and services proactively. BDT harnesses the potential of these programs to reduce hunger and poverty, improve health outcomes, and advance racial equity and economic mobility. Benefits Data Trust  seeks a Senior Data Analyst to perform advanced analysis and data integrations so BDT can serve more clients, incorporate data from new partners, and scale our work. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and carrying out analysis projects and producing technical requirements for data transfers with partners. For data analysis, they will work with stakeholders, design and execute projects, and work hands-on with data analysis in SQL and Python. For our data transfers, they will work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to continually improve our understanding and documentation of partner data. Based on this understanding, they will validate data transfers and write requirements for our Data Engineering team for list exports and ingestion and outreach. The ideal candidate is a well-rounded professional seeking an opportunity to work on business-critical, high-impact systems and be a part of a dynamic organization. The  Senior Data Analyst  reports to the  Senior Analytics Manager . Our office is currently operating   under a remote-working protocol, following governmental requirements and CDC guidelines d ue to COVID-19 . Main Responsibilities:  Collaborate with stakeholders to design, execute, and communicate impactful analysis projects Develop insightful analytical questions through dialog with stakeholders and data exploration Identify and apply appropriate analytical methods and explain the benefits and limitations of those methods Educate staff and partners with engaging presentations and written documents incorporating compelling storytelling and visualization best practices Create and improve analytical coding and technical standards and processes for data analysis and integrations code that drives improved quality, clarity, and reusability Develop complex and reusable scripts in Python and SQL Communicate with internal and external stakeholders, with varying levels of technical expertise, to understand partner data management and file transfer systems, including business process mapping, entity-relationship models, and support the writing of detailed file transfer specifications Validate data transfers against detailed specifications, test new system components, and troubleshoot issues in transfers and data ingestion and reporting systems, as needed, in collaboration with our Data Engineers Produce and maintain clear documentation for data transfers in support of security, audit, privacy, and other applicable guidelines, policies, and contracts Requirements:  Five+ years of experience in the areas of data analysis and data management Bachelor's in mathematics, computer science or similar area, or equivalent experience Strong skills with analytical tools and technologies including or similar to our current toolset: Excel, Python, BigQuery (SQL), Looker (Business Intelligence platform) Solid communication and presentation skills to both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders Ability to elicit business requirements and technical specifications Able to manage competing priorities: work with stakeholders to prioritize multiple ongoing projects Strong collaboration skills, perseverance, and attention to detail. This role bridges gaps between data formats/systems and internal teams About BDT Benefits Data Trust (BDT) harnesses the power of data, technology, and policy to provide efficient and dignified access to assistance, improving people's health and financial security. Together with a national network of government agencies and other partners, we streamline public benefits systems and directly connect eligible families and individuals to programs that help pay for food, healthcare, housing, and more. A nonprofit since 2005, BDT has secured more than $7.5 billion in benefits for households across the country, building pathways to economic mobility and a more equitable future. Learn more about BDT - a proud recipient of a 2021 Top Workplaces USA Award - at BDTrust.org. Job Type: Full-time

Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currency and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide. Circle platforms and products provide a suite of internet-native financial services for payments, treasury infrastructure and capital formation. Circle is also a principal developer of USD Coin (USDC), which has become the fastest growing dollar digital currency in the world. USDC has grown to over 40 billion in circulation and supported over $1.3 trillion in transactions in the past year. Circle's payments and treasury infrastructure services available through the Circle Account and APIs helps bridge the legacy financial system and digital currency and blockchain based finance. Circle's SeedInvest service brings internet-native fundraising and capital formation to startups and growth companies. Combined, Circle's suite of services helps companies to participate in a more open, global and inclusive financial system.  What you'll be part of:  With the mission "To raise global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value," Circle was founded on the belief that the internet, blockchains and digital currency will rewire the global economic system, creating a fundamentally more open, inclusive, efficient and integrated world economy. We envision a global economy where people and businesses everywhere can more freely connect and transact with each other with new technologies for digital money and internet-native finance. We believe such a system can raise prosperity for people and companies everywhere. Our mission is powered by the values we espouse and which we expect all Circlers to respect. We are Multistakeholder, serving the needs of our customers, our shareholders, our employees and families, our local communities and our world. Furthermore, we are also Mindful, Driven by Excellence, and High Integrity. What you'll be responsible for:  As a Data Scientist, Analytics at Circle, you'll work closely with product stakeholders and engineers to better understand our products and enable better decision making with data. Your job will include making sure teams are focused on the biggest opportunities, defining success metrics and goals, and communicating insights throughout the company. We are a passionate team with a deeply analytical mindset, and your work will support us in our mission to be a world-class company driven by data.  What you'll work on:   Own a domain end-to-end, understand the business problems, define and monitor key metrics, identify opportunities and drive conversations around where to invest engineering resources  Measure business performance, develop core metrics and create dashboards to track and understand them.  Identify data, metrics and analyses needs for business partners; Initiate, develop and maintain data pipelines and data models that powers dashboards and data products with outstanding craftsmanship.  Perform deep analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, and extract key insights that impact product decisions.  Perform analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, extracting key insights and communicating to stakeholders to impact product decisions  Communicate the state of business, experiments results and recommendations to a broad team and senior leadership  Data collection and analysis of blockchain activity to understand trading activity, incentives, and how USDC fits in to the broader crypto ecosystem   What you'll bring to Circle:   3+ years of industry experience working with and analyzing large data sets  Experience in data analyses using SQL and at least one programming language (e.g. R, Python)  Understanding of statistics and experience applying them to business problems  Experience planning and executing analytical projects  Be able to proactively manage prioritization of work and deliver work with great quality and influence the broader team in creating leverage.  Previous experience working with financial services data or crypto is a plus.  Experience with Looker, Tableau or other business intelligence platforms.  Domain experience in product, marketing, growth, or other business analytics, compliance, risk areas.  Experience manipulating large amounts of structured and unstructured data.  We are an  equal opportunity employer  and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Advito, BCD Travel's consulting firm, is looking for a Data Scientist. Do you  have a passion for data and a deep understanding to store, mine, and create synergies surrounding data? In this newly created role you look beyond what’s on the surface to discover patterns and solutions within the data. Data Scientist Full time, homebased in the US or Europe You will architect the data process and strategy for Advito and, specifically, BCD Hotel Solutions. You are a liaison to the Advito Intelligence and Analytics team. You own and maintain all analytical processes and standard operating procedures and work with BCD Hotel Solutions leadership on bringing the data optimization vision to life. The primary responsibility for this role is applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. A snapshot of this opportunity Architect processes for acquiring, cleaning, integrating and storing data Suggest and implement appropriate models or algorithms for data performance Apply data science techniques (machine learning, statistical modeling, predictive analytics) to solve for current and future issues Design and drive experiments, A/B testing, outlier deep dives and form actionable recommendations. Manage the implementation of those recommendations Understand our product offerings and optimize data for industry-leading delivery of intelligence and consulting services Share insights and make business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information Contribute knowledge to larger BCD Hotel Solutions initiatives to improve quality, processes and product offerings Improve organizational performance through the application of original thinking to existing and emerging methods, processes, products and services. How you can set yourself apart Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics or Mathematics Experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at a solution using available data Comfortable working with large data sets, creating data models and algorithms Strong data management skills, understanding of data ingestion, ETL, and data storage Experience working with data visualization tools (eg: AWS QuickSight, Tableau) History of working within AWS cloud infrastructure and its available toolsets Exposure to statistical methods and modeling in tools like R or Python as well as data querying languages (e.g. SQL) Advanced critical thinking, analytical and quantitative skills Strong relationship-building skills and able to communicate complex ideas High bandwidth and multi-tasking skills – easily able to handle competing priorities, remain flexible and derive creative solutions under pressure About Advito Advito is the travel industry's most progressive consultancy, enabling procurement leaders to modernize their approach to managing the travel and meetings spend category. job_title: Lead Natural Language Processing Data Scientist/Engineer
job_Description: Lead NLP Data Scientist/Engineer Founded in 2017 by parents with a child born with a rare disease, TREND Community's vision is to revolutionize the world's understanding of diseases. Leveraging AI techniques, such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML), our technology analyzes real-world conversations to uncover insights that our communities and clients use to: help establish natural history, identify unmet needs, understand the quality of life issues, catalyze research, and spread awareness to name a few. As a result, our community-centric approach is accelerating the discovery and delivery of new treatments. We are looking for an individual who is highly passionate about using AI to improve the world we live in and lead our current engineering team. You will play a critical role in TREND Community's engineering initiatives working alongside the technical co-founder to help define the vision for the company's AI products and build a world-class engineering team. In return, you will see firsthand the direct impact our work has on our communities. What you will be doing Build upon and lead an effective AI team with a strong engineering culture that consistently delivers excellent results through rapid iteration; Provide thought leadership and establish a technical vision for the team; Foster a culture of ongoing progress through mentoring, feedback, and tools to measure efficiency and outcomes; Construct a world-class team by hiring and developing NLP engineers; Work with co-founders, advisers, and other stakeholders to identify promising directions, resources, and execute critical projects. What we are looking for No less than five years experience leading AI teams to deliver NLP solutions in real-world applications; Experience in developing and launching end-to-end natural language products; Experience recruiting and managing an engineering team, including performance and engineering management; A successful track record of delivering successfully within aggressive timelines; Strong organization and prioritization skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills; BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent experience. Additional Skills & Experience Familiarity with the Apache Spark ecosystem; Understanding of the Data Lakehouse architecture; Experience working with social-media datasets; Experience with cloud computing stacks, specifically AWS. What we offer Competitive salary ranging from $140,000 - $180,000/year, DOE; Medical Insurance; Paid Time Off; Equity; Close-knit team; Incredible mission and leadership passionate about the cause; Ability to create meaningful work that will change people's lives; Huge opportunity to grow and lead a team. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. To be considered for this position, applicants will be asked to complete an online technical assessment Job Type: Full-time Pay: $130,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: Entire staff is vaccinated. Ability to commute/relocate: Philadelphia, PA 19103: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Leading AI teams: 5 years (Preferred) developing and launching NLP products: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Company Description Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.   Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies. In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 50,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing. Â In 2020, Eurofins generated   total revenues of EUR â‚¬ 5.4 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.   Job Description  Ensure that the client receives quality data by reviewing laboratory notebooks for accuracy, clarity and adherence to GMP and/or GLP regulations Verify data follows all method, industry, and client requirements where applicable Review simple and complex routine and non-routine assay documentation according to departmental, corporate, and client SOPs Review and authorize written reports (Certificate of Analysis, client reports) Perform scientific calculations Diagnose problems and suggest solutions in a professional area Review methods and protocols Read and understand analytical procedures   Qualifications The Ideal Candidate would possess: Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies Previous Data Review or QA experience in a GMP laboratory Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills, including experience with LIMS and Microsoft Office Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in biology or realted scientific field 1-3 years of previous laboratory experience is required Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship Additional Information Position is full-time, Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, PA are encouraged to apply. Excellent full time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options Life and disability insurance 401(k) with company match Paid vacation and holidays Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Overview: CubeSmart seeks a Data Scientist to join the Analytics and Revenue Management department at its Malvern, PA headquarters. Reporting to the Director of Data Science, the Data Scientist will drive significant revenue growth through development of advanced machine learning models, price optimization, marketing analytics, budget allocation, and other advanced analytics that span all functions of the Company. Who We Are At CubeSmart, we’re intentional about culture. You can experience it everywhere from our mission statement of “genuine care” to our “It’s What’s Inside That Counts” tagline to calling each other “teammates” rather than employees. This spirit fosters a fun and collaborative environment that has resulted in our rapid growth and being recognized amongst the top in our industry.  CubeSmart’s award-winning team is made up of people who genuinely care. Teammates care about our customers and the life events and/or business needs they are facing. Teammates are passionate, responsible, and understanding. The CubeSmart team is made up of people who have a can-do attitude, are committed to their own success and the success of the company, and lead by example.  If this sounds like a team and culture that matches your personal values and motivations, we want to hear from you. Responsibilities: Contribute to the maintenance and development of CubeSmart’s proprietary pricing and revenue management system. Key responsibilities include data acquisition and evaluation, machine learning algorithm development, model performance reporting and price recommendation. Conduct marketing analytics and collaborate with Marketing, Operations, and Pricing to continually improve customer acquisition and retention, maximize customer lifetime value, make product recommendation, and enhance customer services. Analyze customer journey to gain insights into all important customer touchpoints, understand their impact on customer’s experience and overall financial results. Sample responsibilities include response modeling, product recommendation, marketing attribution modeling, and reinforcement learning. Develop analytical solutions to enhance and optimize the digital sales funnel, including optimization of paid search bidding models; and customer-centric promotion, pricing, and online experiences. Mine unstructured data for customer insights and business opportunities. Engage with internal stakeholders (e.g., IT, Marketing, Pricing, Operations) and external agencies (e.g., data vendors, Market Research firms) to facilitate the collection and interpretation of customer, operational data. Qualifications: MS in a quantitative discipline (Data Science, Statistics, Math, Operations Research, Engineering, or similar) 0 to 5 years of industry experience in a developing and applying predictive models to solve real-world problems through work experience and/or academic projects Knowledge of a vast set of statistical models and packages, including traditional statistical models (e.g., linear, logistic regressions, time-series models, clustering) as well as machine learning algorithms (e.g., random forest, boosted trees, SVM, neural networks, and deep learning) Proficiency in using data visualization packages to understand the trends influencing business challenges, and to evaluate the efficacy of predictive models Proficient in programming in SQL, Python, and R; experienced in working with large datasets Ability to work independently and interface effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues Strong listening and communication skills are essential A team player who demonstrates strong interpersonal skill and is effective in presenting complex analytical results to audience of diverse backgrounds  Work Environment We foster a collaborative work environment where teammates are encouraged to explore innovative solutions in partnership with their teammates. We are inquisitive and questioning of each other and our work, to encourage a culture of constant innovation. In addition, working at CubeSmart, you will: Join a company that is a leader in REIT, especially in data-driven innovations Join a company that is one of the top 50 Best Companies to Work for in North America Join a large, diverse analytics team who work on reporting, segmentation, market research, predictive modeling, forecasting, prescriptive analytics, marketing analytics, price optimization, revenue management, and much more Work on high-impact projects across all business functions, including strategic investment, marketing, pricing, sales process, operations, and customer service Be provided with opportunities for both your professional and personal development and growth #LI-KM1 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer,  Minority/Female/Veteran/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Picwell helps people make better insurance choices. Navigating the American healthcare system is difficult, and having the right insurance can improve both people's finances and their access to healthcare. Picwell builds a data-driven product to help individuals, like us, easily find the right insurance. We provide helpful insurance recommendations at scale by combining software engineering, statistics/machine learning/artificial intelligence, and health and behavioral economics. Our recommendations help thousands of families every week, and those who follow our advice save about $800 a year on average on health insurance, every year. (To see how our recommendation engine works, visit https://demo.picwell.com.) Furthermore, we are growing! We have achieved 30-40% revenue growth in our direct-to-user product for the last 2 years, and we are on the path to achieve a similar growth in 2021. We are expanding our products to cover health saving account (HSA) contributions and other insurances, such as dental, vision, and ancillary and voluntary insurances. Here at Picwell, we are proud of the welcoming and collaborative environment we have cultivated over the years. The team will help you improve your data engineering skills; you may also learn web development, machine learning/statistical modeling, and DevOps skills, depending on your interest. You will also learn about the insurance designs, which will definitely help you choose better benefits in the future; however, we believe that you will still want to use Picwell's recommendation engine for its accuracy and convenience! We offer competitive salaries and benefits in health/dental/vision insurances, HSA with employer contribution, and 401(K). We are looking for  a data engineer with 2-4 years of professional experience . You will spend your time on Building and revising our extract-transform-load pipelines. Devising better data models for SQL and no-SQL databases. Collaborating with data scientists to build and maintain our data products. Collaborating with software engineers to improve our product with the curated data. Working with site reliability engineers to improve our data infrastructure. For this position, you should Enjoy thinking about better ways to process, store and retrieve data. Have good verbal and written communication skills. Have experience designing relational databases and using SQL effectively. Be able to write on clear, maintainable, and testable code using various programming frameworks, such as object-oriented programming. Be curious to ask good questions. Be eager and able to learn new things. Before we go over our wish list, we want to emphasize that people rarely meet all the requirements on the following list. Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups frequently do not apply unless they satisfy all the qualifications; we encourage you to prove that these statistics are wrong and apply even if you do not. The following are a plus: Degree in computer science, software engineering, or any related discipline Programming experience in Python Experience with pipeline frameworks, especially Luigi Experience in Apache Spark Experience in various AWS services, such as: step functions, lambda functions, ECS Experience in Docker Experience with NoSQL DBs, we use MongoDB and Elasticsearch Experience working with RESTful APIs Experience in machine learning/statistical modeling Understanding of the insurance rules (e.g. copay vs coinsurance or embedded and non-embedded deductibles) and the insurance industry (e.g. how insurance brokers work) Fully remote work is possible, but we prefer candidates who can occasionally come into the office.' ' Work Remotely Yes Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $90,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: People need to be fully vaccinated or wear masks to come into the office. Many employees are working fully remotely even though they are in the Philadelphia area. Application Question(s): Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)? Experience: data engineering: 2 years (Required) programming: 2 years (Required) Work Location: One location

job_title: Survey Methods and Data Science Assistant
job_Description: SSRS is a full-service market and survey research firm managed by a core of dedicated professionals. The SSRS team is renowned for its multimodal approach. Typical projects for the company include complex strategic, tactical and public opinion initiatives in the US and in more than 40 countries worldwide. SSRS is research, refined. SSRS provides rewarding careers that stretch your abilities, enabling you to continuously learn and contribute to our world class team of Survey Research professionals. We offer a learning environment with a team approach to deliver solutions to our client s challenges.  Job Summary  The SSRS Methods, Analytics, and Data Science team (MADS) is looking for a smart, committed, data analyst to provide support in a variety of statistical and methodological tasks, including survey imputation and weighting, sample design, and other data science enterprises. We seek candidates who want to join a fast-paced team of researchers, survey methodologists, data scientists, and analysts; who are driven to learn new skills and techniques; who pride themselves on delivering high-quality work; and who can think outside the box to solve challenges; and who can have fun doing it. Key Responsibilities   Assist in the design and implementation of rigorous, efficient methods for sampling from diverse populations and weighting resultant survey data;  Prepare and process both structured and unstructured data sets;  Support project teams by providing technical help with sample planning, weighting, and other methodological and survey design issues;  Assist in methodological research and development aimed at improving the representativeness of sample survey data;  Support the development and writing of research papers, professional conference presentations, and journal articles.   Position Requirements   Undergraduate degree in statistics, social sciences or related field  Coursework in applied mathematics or statistics, quantitative social science, and/or survey research methods  Skilled in the use of computer software, especially packages for statistical analysis (SAS, Stata, R, or SPSS) and knowledge of computing platforms and data file construction  Meticulous, attentive to detail, and able to collaborate and work well in teams or independently  Willing and able to work across projects and learn new skills quickly in a collaborative and fast-paced environment   SSRS offers full medical benefits, 401K, ESOP, tuition reimbursement a collaborative culture and more.  Visit www.ssrs.com for more information.

Company Description Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.   Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies. In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 50,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing. Â In 2020, Eurofins generated   total revenues of EUR â‚¬ 5.4 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.   Job Description  Determine if data is compliant and defendable based on industry regulations and methodology Verify scientific data is of sound quality following all method, industry, and client requirements where applicable Ensure that the client receives quality data by reviewing laboratory data for accuracy, clarity, and adherence to GMP and/or GLP regulations Review simple and complex routine and non-routine data (for three or more areas) according to departmental, corporate, and client SOPs; read and understand analytical procedures; ensure all work is performed according to GLP/GMP requirements and apply GLP/GMP in all areas of responsibility as appropriate Diagnose problems, solve simple problems, and suggest solutions to complex problems in professional area Review methods to ensure procedures are followed Authorize written reports (e.g., SOP, OMC, client reports)   Qualifications The Ideal Candidate would possess: Previous experience with LIMS preferred Previous experience with Excel Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in chemistry, mathematics, physics, or other related degree concentration, or equivalent directly-related experience Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship Additional Information Position is full-time, Monday - Friday 7:00am - 3:00pm. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, PA are encouraged to apply. Excellent full time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options Life and disability insurance 401(k) with company match Paid vacation and holidays Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Why This Role is Important to Us The Data Science Partner at Commonwealth Care Alliance (CCA) is a clinical/business-facing and technical-facing role that collaborates with clinical/business stakeholders to understand how data can be used to improve 1. the lives of our members and 2. the delivery of healthcare and services to them. This role will require an expert understanding of CCA's data assets and analytics/insights and their utility to the clinical/business organization. This role will be a member of the Data Science team at CCA and be a part of the team effort to build end-to-end data pipelines for descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics. The Data Science Partner will focus on the data extraction and processing, analytics, feature engineering/selection, modeling and evaluation, results delivery and model implementation. This role needs to be a "full-stack" data scientist and has the exciting opportunity to contribute code and ideas at any part of the stack, with a focus on end user value. This position will work closely with our Data Engineers and Product Managers, and will report to Director, Data Science. This role may be 100% remote-based. What You'll Be Doing Contribute to the creation of analytics platforms and data products that will drive core business processes and be used by analysts across the organization Support ongoing deployment of predictive models which help CCA members/organization Conduct directed analysis to help clinical/business leadership make better, data driven decisions Maintain a current knowledge of emerging tools and techniques in machine learning, natural language processing, database systems, visualization, statistical modeling, data extraction/manipulation and so on Be an expert and keep expanding knowledge in healthcare, health insurance and CCA database Complete data science projects independently with minimum supervisor and guidance Propose and conduct optimal solution to projects independently What We're Looking For Doctorate degree OR master's degree + 4 year of equivalent work experience OR bachelor's degree + 8 years of equivalent work experience (STEM major or related field preferred) Technical Skills Expertise with Python (numpy, pandas, sklearn, nltk...) Expertise with relational databases and SQL Expertise with data visualization and tools Experience with data exploration, data wrangling and feature engineering Experience and excellent understanding of machine learning modeling techniques and algorithms Experience with applied statistics Familiarity and comfort with Linux system Strong scripting and programming skills Strong analytical mindset Willingness to learn new technologies Experience with cloud data warehouses and cloud provider services (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure) Track record of working on the machine learning pipeline from ideation, model training, through to deployment and production support Track record of success in technology or software development environment Track record of successful analytics projects of define and decomposite business/technical problems and solve them Ability to develop competence in any programming, tool, or technology, that a problem requires; be data and tool omnivorous Soft Skills Be organized and flexible Take initiative to own projects Be able to work with interdisciplinary teams Be able to explain technical concepts/results to non-technical audiences Passion for creating work that is well-documented and reproducible Ability to work with short iteration times in agile mode as well as the ability to carry out projects in a self-directed manner Healthcare: passion for working at a healthcare organization Preferred Experience with R Experience in healthcare or health insurance organization Experience with clinical claims and health record data Experience building data pipelines in the cloud under the constraints of HIPAA Publication or presentation of innovation in data science, machine learning or related area English Job Type: Full-time Pay: $90,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: Python: 1 year (Preferred) SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Data Scientist / Engineer (Remote)  LightingNewYork.com | Remote  At Lighting New York, we work to acquire raving fans by retaining excellent team members who are dedicated to the culture and growth of the organization and strive to provide the best in class customer experience, home goods product selection and value. We're one of the fastest growing businesses in our industry and we're looking for A+ team members to help us continue that growth.  If the idea of scripting SQL data using validation tables matched up with 3rd party data to generate an XML data feed triggered by delta variations to ensure accurate and timely information sharing even makes sense to you - then we should talk!  As an eCommerce business that also has an expansive Sales team, we collect a lot of data. The problem, of course, is what to do with it! Hopefully, that's where you come in. We collect data in a variety of ways - like SQL databases, XML feeds, and through third parties (like Google Analytics), and we know that we can do powerful things with it - we just need someone to help us put it all together.  This role will act as a data scientist alongside our application developers to create business-critical feeds, integrations, and a repository of the single source of truth for the business. You should be a strong technologist, with tools like python and SQL management in your background while also demonstrating the ability to comprehend and communicate how the data sources interact.  This position can be a fully-remote role. Lighting New York is headquartered in Selinsgrove, PA (about 45 minutes north of Harrisburg) and we'd love to have you onsite periodically, but it's more important to us to find the right person to succeed in this role - whether you are remote or local. If you have the experience and drive to take this fun, exciting company to the next level - we'd like to talk!   Some Requirements for the role:  Experience and broad understanding of databases, including SQL Server. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) Experience working with and creating data architectures. General understanding of 3rd party hosted (SAAS) data platforms like Snowflake, Splunk, Redshift, or others. An innate sense of urgency and competitiveness with a drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Excellent oral and written communication skills for coordinating across teams. Excellent communicator & creative thinker, with an ability to use both data & intuition to inform decisions. Experience using reporting and/or visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau. eCommerce industry experience preferred Very skilled with Microsoft Excel Strong organizational and project management skills, coupled with attention to detail. You have the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment Must be an enthusiastic self-starter, responsive to instruction and eager to learn more while having a knack for being innovative and inquisitive, while remaining practical and decisive  You play well with others.   ABOUT LIGHTING NEW YORK  LightingNewYork.com is one of the fastest growing online lighting retailers in the US and a Pennsylvania “Best Place to Work” for the last 3 years. Located in Central Pennsylvania, our expanding team works hard to always move forward, but we don't underestimate the value of having some fun. We pride ourselves on being different from our competition by making an effort to “wow” every person we come in contact with in our daily business endeavors. We work collaboratively with over 150 different vendors and strive to bring a personal and expert-driven experience to every one of our customers. As such, we look for team members that are adventurous, self-motivated, and enjoy being a part of this pursuit.

Are you willing to make a difference? Data Scientist At Kulicke and Soffa, (NASDAQ:KLIC) our engineers make that decision daily. We are an international leading provider of robotic semiconductor packaging and electronic assembly solutions supporting the global automotive, consumer, communications, computing and industrial segments. Meaning…medical equipment , cell phones, autonomous automobiles, computers, space operations …all of these use products that our equipment helps to make. Data Scientist - Position summary: Duties: Work with cross-functional teams to research, develop and deliver solutions for machine learning problems, from concept, to design and implementation Develop data pipelines for data preprocessing, analysis and model development Experience: Experience with machine learning, including classification, clustering and outlier (anomaly) detection Experience with machine learning for temporal data (time-series): Basic characteristics of time-series and theory of time-series analysis Experience with novelty and outlier detection for time-series Experience with classification of time-series: classical techniques and Neural networks Tools: Fluent in the common python data science tool stack (Numpy, Scipy, Sklearn, Jupyter notebook/lab ) Experience with developing visualizations using Python (Matplotlib, Plotly, Seaborn, Bokeh) Experience with standard industrial data analytics tools is a plus (JMP, Tableau) Strong Computer Science background and programming experience Fluent with 1 or more programming language (Python, Java, C++) Experience with Object oriented design Experience with databases (SQL) Master’s or Phd degree in Computer Science or related programs (Data Science, Physics, Statistics …) Nice to have: Knowledge of statistical process control (SPC) Background in designing data storage solutions Experience with No-SQL databases What we have to offer:  Competitive salary with bonus, 401K, innovative work environment that can offer cross functional challenging projects, variety and continual learning growth is a given not a maybe, supportive/friendly/brilliant co-workers rated highest in satisfaction from our internal employee survey.  Interested? We began as a start-up and now 65 years later as a successful public corporation, still retain the spirit of offering our core values to employees and customers alike. With R&D centers of excellence in the USA, Europe and Asia, we bring together today’s generation of talent, collaborating on tomorrow’s technologies. For more information, please forward your resume to us. Kulicke & Soffa is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender expression and gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. location: BNY Mellon Center 500 Grant Street, Suite 2500, Pittsburgh, PA 15219
job_Description: We are The Lighthouse within KPMG's Consulting practice. We tap into the power of emerging technologies and scientific breakthroughs to create solutions and products that address the largest and most complex issues faced by global companies. By blending technology with our industry expertise, we're able to harness the potential of Cloud, AI, ML, IoT, 5G, and quantum computing to design and implement real-world solutions for a variety of business problems. Work with confidence knowing your ideas are heard and backed by one of the world's top professional services firms. Spark your curiosity and ignite your career at The Lighthouse. KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate Data Modeler who specializes in NLP and/or AI to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics. Responsibilities: Work in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams to translate business objectives into artificial intelligence approaches and objectives; capture business domains into knowledge bases, taxonomies, and ontologies across different areas (risk management, financial services, mergers and acquisitions, and public policy) Work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with both virtual and face-to-face interactions; utilize structured approaches to solving problems, managing risks, and documenting assumption while communicating results and educating others through insightful visualizations, reports, and presentations Build ingestion processes to prepare, extract, and annotate a rich data variety of unstructured data sources (social media, news, internal/external documents, images, video, voice, emails, financial data, and operational data) Leverage a variety of tools and approaches to solve complex business objectives (Statistical Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval/Extraction, Machine Learning/ Deep Learning, Image Processing, Rules Engines, Knowledge Graphs, and Semantic Search) Deliver on engagement milestones by following analytics processes to manage and mitigate risks in data, modeling, validation, and delivery; Work with others to clear issues Refactor deploy and validate models; work with clients iteratively to validate performance metrics, and sample output to drive towards a business-first solution; utilize APIs, platforms, containers, multi-threading, distributed processing to achieve throughput goals Qualifications: Minimum of three years of experience leading work streams with two plus data scientists, engineers, and other data & analytics professionals, including innovation, quality management, utilizing analytics, software development processes, and modeling processes (data discovery, cleaning, model selection, validation, and deployment); Multidisciplinary backgrounds is preferred Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree from an accredited college/university in a quantitative discipline, such as Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics, including one plus year of training specific to artificial intelligence Ability to apply artificial intelligence techniques to achieve concrete business goals; ability to work with the business to understand available resources and constraints around data (sources, integrity, and definitions), processing platforms, and security; provide assistance, and resolve problems, using solid problem-solving skills, verbal/written communication Understanding of data preparation, machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing; ability to discuss pros and cons of modeling approaches; Understanding of development practices such as testing, code design, complexity, and code optimization Fluency in Python; proficiency in AI related frameworks (NLTK, Spacy, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow); and experience with platforms (Google Cloud, Azure, and AWS); Ability to work with a variety of databases (SQL, ElasticSearch, Solr, Neo4j) Ability to travel when necessary; Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.  At KPMG, any partner or employee must be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to any KPMG office, client site or KPMG event. In some circumstances, individuals who are not fully vaccinated may also be required to have a reasonable accommodation to not be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

You know all the words and abbreviations and yes, to be honest sometimes you’d rather deal with data than people…until the data gives you a message to pass onto the people…er clients, like “this plane will probably lose an engine in two weeks due to the vibrations of the plane and their impact on this fuel intake module.” Let’s be honest, we could put fancy industry specific words into this job posting like Neural Networks, and Python and, and, and… When it comes down to the Data Scientist that we are looking for it’s about knowing your shi… shtuff…  AND  knowing how to work with people in a positive and productive way.  Not only will you be deep diving into all things algorithms but having the ability to translate “Nerd to English” in a way that others can understand is key. If you are a Jack of all Data Science trades, but a master of 1 or 2, you may be the right fit for our team. Plus, we have a plethora of projects running at the same time which allows you to learn new skills and be challenged in your work.  Freya is a service-oriented company that prides itself on promoting continued learning and growth among their employees. Our desire is to help all industries (primarily Air, Defense and Rail) make wise decisions based on predictive analytics and to develop applications to support our clients based on that data. We are changing the way companies handle their maintenance programs, helping them to avoid unnecessary high-risk situations.   Responsibilities:  Problem solving and solutions development using Python  Interacting and being able to communicate clearly with clients  Efficiently clean and analyze complex data sets  Educate and teach the team regarding theory, implementation, and advice regarding Neural Networks  Other projects as requested  Qualifications : Bachelor's Degree in a Hard Science (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Chemistry, etc.)  3+ years of industry experience in a Data Science position  Must know Python and have the capacity to learn R  (SQL is a bonus)  Experience developing/implementing machine learning models in production  Experience in Neural Networks (ANNs, CNNs, RNNs)  Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and strong analytical problem-solving skills  What We Bring to the Table:  Highly competitive salary  Killer benefits package  Ongoing paid educational opportunities  A highly collaborative work environment  What You Bring to the Table:  CURIOSITY : Self-motivated enthusiasm to explore and understand solutions derived from statistical analysis and machine learning techniques  Eagerness to learn and an ability to think outside the box  Collaborative, clear communication  Ability to execute projects from start to finish with little guidance  Positive attitude with strong organization and communication skills    Must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are not able to sponsor visas.  Become a part of the foundation for Freya Systems as we build for the future.  Apply now or call  717.993.4513   Related Skills/Experience : Hard Sciences, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy, Mathematics, Database

job_title: Senior Director/ Research Fellow (technical leader), Data Science, Real World Evidence Analytics and Insights (1 of 2 Openings)
job_Description: Janssen Research & Development LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Senior Director/ Research Fellow (technical leader), Data Science, Real World Evidence Analytics and Insights. The primary location for this position is flexible – either New Brunswick, NJ or Spring House, PA or South San Francisco, CA. Consideration will be given to Raritan, NJ, Titusville, NJ or Beerse, Belgium.  Janssen develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and Development areas encompass Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic disorders, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Infectious diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com.  The Senior Director will:  Partner with the Data Science and Therapeutic Area leaders to conceptualize, lead, shape and deliver Real World Evidence, and advanced analytics solutions and insights for prioritized use cases. Also, drive large strategic and complex projects to achieve the intended impact in a timely manner.  Build and cultivate the right partnerships and alliances with internal and external partners in tandem with Business Development, Innovation Centers, etc.  Independently partner with and mentor the Data Science Real World Evidence Analytics and Insights team of scientists to influence strategy and execute on the priorities, building a roadmap to deliver the projects from data feasibility, study design and analysis, to final presentation to senior cross-functional leaders  As a subject matter expert provide thought leadership for developing, adapting and delivering Real-World Data (“RWD”) methodologies to mitigate observed and unobserved bias and confounding in the execution of comparative effectiveness analyses, time-to-event analyses, external control arm studies, hybrid control arm studies, observational and prospective study designs, and the development of algorithms for risk stratification, creating disease severity indices, etc.  Be a hands-on technical leader among the Data Science team, instituting best practices while crafting a data-driven culture, developing, and mentoring members of the team. Develop a RWE strategy that distinguishes Data Science Analytics & Insights through validating real-world methods and developing novel designs leading to intellectual property patents or publication   Qualifications Required:  A Ph.D./ M.D. degree, or master’s degree in a quantitative science (e.g., epidemiology, statistics, biostatistics, health economics, biomedical informatics, computer science, or similar)  Demonstrated experience and expertise ( >10 years) within the biopharma industry with extensive cross functional experience in drug development and evidence generation including clinical trial statistics, real world evidence, pharmacoepidemiology and clinical development. Expertise in one or more therapeutic areas including oncology, immunology, neuroscience or cardiovascular  Extensive experience with study design and data analysis, statistical modeling, causal inference methods to mitigate observed and residual confounding (propensity score matching/ weighting, instrumental variables, state transition models, comparative effectiveness analysis  Demonstrated experience in real-world data (EHR, insurance claims, registry data) Proven leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners in a matrix organization  Experience in generating regulatory grade evidence (e.g., single arm studies with external controls) for submission to regulatory authorities; communicating and responding to agency reviews and comments  Proven track record of consistently delivering on high impact drug development projects Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills  Demonstrated experience in leading cross-functional teams, managing complex stakeholders and influencing without direct authority.  Ability to work in an agile matrix environment  Expert proficiency in either SAS, R or Python.  Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Preferred:  Expertise with AI/ML machine learning, quantitative methods, predictive and causal modelling and other analytics frameworks and techniques Demonstrated experience driving research using Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing and / or statistical modeling methods  Demonstrated experience through publication and thought leadership that combines clinical prediction and causal inference, and observational research methods  Ability to effectively communicate technical work to a wide audience Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.  #JNJDataScience #JRDDS   Primary Location United States-California-South San Francisco-260 E. Grand Avenue  Other Locations North America-United States-Massachusetts-Cambridge, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Belgium-Antwerp-Beerse, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House, North America-United States-California-La Jolla  Organization Janssen Research & Development, LLC (6084)  Job Function R&D  Requisition ID 2105996145W

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well. We have an incredible opportunity for a  Principal Statistical Programmer  to join the team.  Location : United States (home-based OR office-based) Canada (home-based OR office-based) Europe (home-based OR office-based) United Kingdom (home-based OR office-based) Argentina (home-based OR office-based) Mexico City (home-based OR office-based) South Africa (home-based OR office-based)  Overview of the Role: The Principal Statistical Programmer is responsible for creating, validating, and executing a range of statistical programs and applies extensive domain knowledge in the programming of datasets, tables, figures, and listings for quality and accuracy. The Principal Statistical Programmer will lead and execute multiple projects in parallel, including ongoing coaching and mentorship of individual team members. In this client-facing role, the Principal Statistical Programmer is responsible for leading programming deliverables for complex assignments. The Principal Statistical Programmer will invest in building long-term relationships with clients in a partnership role. The Principal Statistical Programmer will implement creative solutions to balance competing priorities and focus on exceeding client expectations. They will provide managerial leadership including mentorship and training of direct reports. Lead and manage the assigned programming team's deliverables at the study and program level to ensure project objectives are met within budget, to agreed timelines and to the highest standard of quality. Proactively plan for and implement effective resource planning, task allocation and tracking of workload in accordance with agreed metrics (e.g. KPIs) and quality standards. Deliver high quality statistical programming deliverables for all assignments that consistently meets study timelines, quality standards, sponsor and/or contractual requirements. Efficient use of SAS, and adherence to SAS programming guidelines. Create and validate listing and safety outputs (analysis datasets, tables, figures) Create and validate efficacy outputs (analysis datasets, tables, figures) Create and validate complex programs (such as project or departmental macros) Create analysis dataset specifications (ADaM or client-specific) Set-up standard programming directories and start-up utilities. Create, document and validate project/study-macros at the table, listing and figure level. Liaise effectively with other ICON functions (e.g., PM, DM, MW), as required during the life of the project. Travel (approximately 5%) domestic and/or international  To be successful, you will need: 8+ years of experience successfully performing the role of Statistical Programmer, in the clinical research industry Experience with leading multiple projects in parallel - including Phase II and/or Phase III studies Experience with creating and validating analysis datasets (CDISC ADaM standard preferred), and Tables, Listings, and Figures Pinnacle 21 experience is strongly preferred Expert knowledge of SAS Professional leadership skills coupled with exceptional communication skills Education: Bachelor's degree required (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related scientific discipline); Master's degree or PhD preferred  Benefits of Working in ICON: Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That's why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture - one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development. At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future. ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
